block.p: Melinda Maxwell Frank and Andrew Vincent Waskow were married yesterday in Lyme, N.H. Timothy Caldwell, a justice of the peace, officiated at Culver Hill Farm, the home of Dr. and Mrs. John Ketterer, an uncle and an aunt of the bride.

Mrs. Waskow, 31, is a candidate for a Doctor of Veterinary Medicine degree at the University of Pennsylvania. She received a bachelor's degree, a law degree and a master's in cultural anthropology from Duke University. She is a daughter of Audrey B. Frank of Tewksbury, Mass., and the late Walter N. Frank Jr., who was a managing partner and a founder of Walter N. Frank & Company, a specialist firm on the New York Stock Exchange.

Melinda Maxwell Frank and Andrew Vincent Waskow were married yesterday in Lyme, N.H. Timothy Caldwell, a justice of the peace, officiated at Culver Hill Farm, the home of Dr. and Mrs. John Ketterer, an uncle and an aunt of the bride.

Mrs. Waskow, 31, is a candidate for a Doctor of Veterinary Medicine degree at the University of Pennsylvania. She received a bachelor's degree, a law degree and a master's in cultural anthropology from Duke University. She is a daughter of Audrey B. Frank of Tewksbury, Mass., and the late Walter N. Frank Jr., who was a managing partner and a founder of Walter N. Frank & Company, a specialist firm on the New York Stock Exchange.

Mr. Waskow, 31, is a lawyer and a vice president at Merrill Lynch in New York. He graduated from Duke and received a law degree from American University. He is the son of Roberta Lee Waskow and Melvin B. Waskow of Stamford, Conn. His mother is a consultant to health care institutions on long-term care for the elderly. His father owns Metal Elements, a Stamford company that brokers raw materials for the steel industry.
